name: 陳匡正
objective:
本所與美國新罕布夏大學富蘭克林皮爾斯法學院，已於 112 年 5 月 10 日簽署國際學術交流 MOU，而本所為響應學校推動國際化之政策，特別增開 1 門 1 學分之國際雙師課程。本課程乃由美國新罕布夏大學富蘭克林皮爾斯法學院院長 Megan Carpenter 教授、該學院智慧財產權中心主任 Micky Minhas 教授親自來台密集授課，主要提供給欲深入了解美國法律制度、美國智慧財產權法律體系之本所學生、校外實務界人士或欲對赴美留學有興趣人士來選修。而本課程之內容，共分成兩個部分，前半部將以美國法律 (包括法院、普通法、各部門法律等) 之介紹為主，至於後半部則詳細介紹美國智慧財產權各部門法律 (包含著作權法、專利法、營業秘密法、資料保護、商標法等)。而本課程之開課時間，以每學年度上學期之 10 月上旬，並為期 1 週為原則。當然，本課程開設之目的，乃以增強學生實際應用英語之能力，並以加強學生美國智慧財產權法律之知能為主，除了強化本所與美國新罕布夏大學富蘭克林皮爾斯法學院之學術交流關係外，更能夠擴展休課學生之國際人脈及視野。

Graduate Institute of Intellectual Property, National Taipei University of Technology (hereafter called this institute) had made a MOU of international academic cooperation with Franklin Pierce School of Law, University of New Hampshire on May 10, 2023. This institute wants to promote the international policy from the University, so this institute will open a one unit course for international double professional teachers. This course is personally and intensively taught by Professor/Dean Megan Carpenter and Professor/Director Micky Minhas of Franklin Pierce School of Law, University of New Hampshire, and it is mainly provided for this institute’s students, legal practitioners, or someone who are interested in studying in the U.S. for further understanding the U.S. legal and intellectual property law systems. Moreover, contents of this course are divided into two parts: the former part is introductions of the U.S. laws, including courts, common laws, and all aspects of laws, etc.
schedule:
1.11/4 (星期一) 09:10-13:00 美國法律制度 (I) (政府架構、司法體系、普通法、行政法、契約法案例與侵權行為法)
2.11/5 (星期二) 09:10-13:00 美國法律制度 (II) (財產法–智財和科技視野)；智財權介紹 (I) (總則)；課堂案例模擬口試 (I)
3.11/6 (星期三) 17:10-19:20 智財權介紹 (II) (營業秘密及數據資料) 
4.11/7 (星期四) 09:10-13:00 智財權介紹 (III) (著作權及專利權)
5.11/8 (星期五) 09:10-13:00 智財權介紹 (IV) (商標權)；課堂案例模擬口試 (II)

1.11/4 (Monday) 09:10-13:00 U.S. legal system (I) (branches of government, judicial system, common law, administrative law, examples from contracts, and torts)
2.11/5 (Tuesday) 09:10-13:00 U.S. legal system (II) (property – IP and tech lens); Introduction to intellectual property (I) (principle); practical simulation exercise (I)
3.11/6 (Wednesday)	17:10-19:20 Introduction to intellectual property (II) (trade secret & data)
4.11/7 (Thursday) 09:10-13:00	Introduction to intellectual property (III) (copyright & patent) 
5.11/8 (Friday) 09:10-13:00 Introduction to intellectual property (IV) (trademark); practical simulation exercise (II)
